docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 11 The little noticed "fisherman's war" that has been going on sporadically between the United States and Ecuador and Peru for the past 15 years over the innocent but highly edible bluefin tuna was threatening this week to create a...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 11 The little noticed "fisherman's war" that has been going on sporadically between the United States and Ecuador and Peru for the past 15 years over the innocent but highly edible bluefin tuna was threatening this week to create a rift in the Alliance for Progress and jeopardizing attendance at next month's Latin-American heads-ofstate meeting.

headline.main: The Hemisphere; Two Disputes Cloud the Summit The U.S., Latins, and the Bluefin Tuna

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay--By 1944, there was hardly a decent-size wood stove or boiler left in  Uruguay. Thus it was that a Basque immigrant woodcutter named Ascencio Iturrya became technologically unemployed. So he opened a restaurant.
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay--By 1944, there was hardly a decent-size wood stove or boiler left in Uruguay. Thus it was that a Basque immigrant woodcutter named Ascencio Iturrya became technologically unemployed. So he opened a restaurant.

headline.main: In Punta del Este, A Basque Tavern

byline.original: By BARNARD L. COLLIER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 12 --Some of the world's leading businessmen arrived here today for the semiannual meeting of the Chase Manhattan Bank International Advisory Committee.

headline.main: CHASE CONVENING BIG PARLEY IN RIO; Bank Advisory Unit's First Meeting Outside U.S. Seeks to Stress Latin Area

byline.original: By PAUL L. MONTGOMERY Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 13-- President Johnson urged Congress today to approve a commitment to increase aid to Latin America by $1.5-billion over the next five years, or by 30 per cent annually.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 13-- President Johnson urged Congress today to approve a commitment to increase aid to Latin America by $1.5-billion over the next five years, or by 30 per cent annually.
docs.abstract: Johnson asks Cong increase aid by about $1.5-billion over next 5 yrs, contingent on Latin-Amer self-help efforts; resolution draft voices Cong support for Latin-Amer Common Mkt and for US aid through Inter-Amer Development Bank; Sen Fulbright favorable

headline.main: JOHNSON SEEKING 30% LATIN AID RISE; Urges Congress to Commit an Additional $1.5-Billion Over 5-Year Period

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 14-- Secretary of State Dean Rusk pleaded today for swift Congressional approval of a resolution backing United States financial and other support for a proposed Latin-American Common Market.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 14-- Secretary of State Dean Rusk pleaded today for swift Congressional approval of a resolution backing United States financial and other support for a proposed Latin-American Common Market.
docs.abstract: Sec Rusk backs resolution, Sen com hearing; lauds Adm aid concept; Repr Frelinghuysen backs aid but scores resolution wording; readies own draft to include specific sum of money

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 15 (UPI) Latin American diplomats were reported today to be indignant and disappointed over President Johnson's proposal for $1.5-billion in additional aid for hemisphere development.
